item.title: Flip String to Monotone Increasing
item.description: Question A binary string is monotone increasing if it consists of some number of 0’s (possibly none), followed by some number of 1’s (also possibly none). You are given a binary string s. You can flip s[i] changing it from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0. Return the minimum number of flips to make s monotone increasing. Examples Input: s = “00110” Output: 1 Explanation: We flip the last digit to get 00111.

item.title: Trapping Rain Water
item.description: Question Given n non-negative integers representing an elevation map where the width of each bar is 1, compute how much water it can trap after raining. Example Input: height = [0,1,0,2,1,0,1,3,2,1,2,1] Output: 6 Input: height = [4,2,0,3,2,5] Output: 9 Constraints Constraints: n == height.length 0 <= n <= 3 * 104 0 <= height[i] <= 105 Explanation On any point, to trap rain water we need to have walls adjacent to the current point with elevation more than the current elevation.
